intro: Bassovia hispida, commonly known as the rough-hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires full sun and moderate watering.
